docs.snippet: WILLEMSTAD, Curacao, Sept. 10 (UPI) Manuel Santana of Spain, former Wimbledon champion, and Jose Edison Mandarino of Brazil advanced to the final of the Marlboro tennis tournament today.
docs.lead_paragraph: WILLEMSTAD, Curacao, Sept. 10 (UPI) Manuel Santana of Spain, former Wimbledon champion, and Jose Edison Mandarino of Brazil advanced to the final of the Marlboro tennis tournament today.

docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, Sept. 16-- Two years after the bloody coup that toppled the Marxist coalition Government of President Salvador Allende Gossens, the military junta that governs Chile has developed a siege mentalily against critics of its harsh...
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, Sept. 16-- Two years after the bloody coup that toppled the Marxist coalition Government of President Salvador Allende Gossens, the military junta that governs Chile has developed a siege mentalily against critics of its harsh programs for economic recovery and of its continuing violations of human rights.
docs.abstract: NY Times survey of conditions in Chile 2 yrs after Allende coup finds mil junta has developed siege mentality against critics of its harsh programs for econ recovery and its continuing violations of human rights; notes junta has vowed to continue austerity program aimed almost exclusively at dampening perennial rise in inflation and diminishing state's role in econ; arbitrary arrests and repts of torture have reptdly declined in recent mos, apparently because of mil's confidence that threat of subversion has eased with banning of Marxist pol groups and other pol parties in indefinite suspension; mil junta inherited annual inflation rate of about 700% investment had disappeared, indus and agrarian production declined sharply and there were widespread shortages of all goods and rampant black mkt; copper, exports of which provides 85% of Chile's foreign-exch earnings, has been selling at depressed prices in world mkt; junta and its supporters contend Govt 'shock treatment,' aimed at curbing inflation by cutting demand, is working because Govt spending and revenues have been narrowed to 12%, compared with 50% public deficit under Allende's Govt; effects of shock treatment have been devastating with unemployment up to 20% leaving 700,000 people jobless in work force of 3.5-million; Govt has begun emergency work program to provide jobs but low income falls short of minimum monthly food requirements of family of 5; illus (L)

headline.main: Chilean Junta Resisting Critics; Chilean Junta Is Resisting Its Critics

byline.original: By JONATHAN KANDELL Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LISBON, Sept. 19--Portugal is not Chile! they cry at every political demonstration and in private conversations. But the Portuguese nevertheless identify their revolution with Chile's  lost cause. The late Dr. Salvador Allende Gossens has become a...
docs.lead_paragraph: LISBON, Sept. 19--Portugal is not Chile! they cry at every political demonstration and in private conversations. But the Portuguese nevertheless identify their revolution with Chile's lost cause. The late Dr. Salvador Allende Gossens has become a Portuguese national hero and his portrait is seen everywhere.
docs.abstract: News analysis on Portuguese identity with Chilean revolution; says late Dr Salvador Allende Gossens has become Portuguese natl hero; finds some similarities between 2 Govts but says basic pol, soc and econ structures are widely divergent; notes that fundamental difference is in mil; says that Socialist changes in Chile were carried out initially with active neutrality of most mil men while in Portugual it was mil men who opened way to Socialism (L)

headline.main: Lisbon and Chile: Diverse Paths; Democratic Solution Is Being Sought by Portuguese

byline.original: By MARVINE HOWE Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY--Even before its formal creation in Panama this week, chauvinistic rivalries among Latin America's four wealthiest nations are undermining the latest attempt at a regional economic organization capable of uniting the continent in face of...
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY--Even before its formal creation in Panama this week, chauvinistic rivalries among Latin America's four wealthiest nations are undermining the latest attempt at a regional economic organization capable of uniting the continent in face of the industrialized world.
docs.abstract: hopes to use proposed Latin-Amer Econ System to increase intra-regional trade tempered by existence of numerous trade blocs which have failed to stimulate econ integration of area; trade within region generally limited to raw materials; almost 80% of Latin-Amer imports come from developed countries, 75% of exports go to industrialized world (S)

headline.main: Two of the Four Wealthiest Nations Are Trying to Put It Off; A New Latin Trade Pact Is Not Easy

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 12-- Just about every Argentine is asking whether Isabel Martinez de Peron will return from her month's leave of absence and resume an active presidency.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 12-- Just about every Argentine is asking whether Isabel Martinez de Peron will return from her month's leave of absence and resume an active presidency.
docs.abstract: Article discusses Argentine Pres Isabel Peron's doubtful return to power; raises question that if Peron voluntarily took vacation amid mounting terrorism, deteriorating econ, pol dissension and failing health, or if she was squeezed out by maneuverings of high officials in Govt; also questions Interim Pres Italo Luder's move to dismiss Mins of Defense and Interior, pres sec and declare new and open style of politics, if he believed Peron would return; says main question is can Pres Peron hold on to presidency if she decides to return to Govt House; notes Interim Pres Italo Luder's and Interior Min Angel Robledo's trip to Cordoba to allegedly persuade Peron to extend leave of absence; speculates that Pres Peron will not extend her period in office beyond Oct 17, 30th anniv of Juan D Peron's release from detention; notes Govt has given in to mil demands for full control over battle against subversion in view of recent guerrilla attacks; notes Argentine inflation has reached 200% since Jan, virtually wiping out 100% wage increases that labor unions extracted from Govt in June; Luder illus (M)

headline.main: A Decisive Time for Mrs. Peron; She Plans to Return Amid Moves to Dislodge Her The Key Question Military Speaks Out A Peron Anniversary Economy Unimproved

byline.original: By JONATHAN KANDELL Special to The New York TimesAssociated Press

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, Oct. 13 (UPI) The shooting team saved the day for the United States today after the track stars suffered a series of reverses on an opening day of competition at the Pan-American Games in which the hostility between the Cuban and...
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, Oct. 13 (UPI) The shooting team saved the day for the United States today after the track stars suffered a series of reverses on an opening day of competition at the Pan-American Games in which the hostility between the Cuban and American athletes was plainly evident.
docs.abstract: Article on Oct 13 events at Pan Amer Games, Mex City, Mex (M)
